metadata.title: CVE-2024-42269 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved:netfilter: iptables: Fix potential null-ptr-deref inip6table_nat_table_init().ip6table_nat_table_init() accesses net->gen->ptr[ip6table_nat_net_ops.id],but the function is exposed to user space before the entry is allocatedvia register_pernet_subsys().Let's call register_pernet_subsys() before xt_register_template().

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2024-42269` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-1001-fips - 4.4.0-1001.1
linux-image-extra-4.4.0-1001-fips - 4.4.0-1001.1
linux-image-hmac-4.4.0-1001-fips - 4.4.0-1001.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux-fips package in fips/xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1001.1').
